intro: Lodhra sulcata, commonly known as the Indian privet, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly serrated margin. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by dark blue, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest edges and riverine areas. The plant has medicinal uses in traditional Ayurvedic practices.
